snippet: A Senate panel is prepared to draft legislation that would give Congress some authority over lifting sanctions against Iran, a measure that President Obama fears would disrupt diplomacy over the country’s nuclear program.
abstract: Senate Foreign Relations Committee is expected to formally draft bill that would give Congress some control over lifting sanctions on Iran, bid to influence diplomacy that has taken place regarding country's nuclear aspirations; Republican lawmakers are trying to preserve bipartisan support for measure even as Obama administration has dispatched staff to win over senators.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and JENNIFER STEINHAUER
byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Panama, Michael R. Gordon from Washington, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: A Senate panel is prepared to draft legislation that would give Congress some authority over lifting sanctions against Iran, a measure that President Obama fears would disrupt diplomacy over the country’s nuclear program.

headline.main: Seeking Voice in Iran Deal, Lawmakers Are Set to Act
headline.print_headline: Seeking Voice in Iran Deal, Lawmakers Are Set to Act
